description: A Value-Added service provided by Nepal Telecom. The subscriber can record their notice or information to their Notice Board number by using Nepal Telecom's Mobile/Landline/VSAT telephone. If any mobile/landline, VSAT number calls to the notice board number, recorded notices or information is played. The recorded notices/information can be easily edited or deleted as required by the subscriber.

features: No need to add new equipment at customer's premises.
Anyone with landline or without landline can take service.
Notice board owners can record/edit/delete his/her notice board message by themselves.
Notices are password protected so that nobody can edit/play with the uploaded messages apart from the owner.
Message duration for notice can vary from 1-3 minutes.

users: Schools/Colleges for General and Emergency notices
Business organizations for Product Information, Ads, etc.
Airline offices for Flight information and updates
Traffic Police Office for Traffic updates
Money Exchanges Centers and Banks for Forex rates
FM radios/TV stations for Program schedules
Education Related Consultancies for related information.

steps: To subscribe Audio Notice Board Service, subscribers need to fill up a form and FAX it to 01-4227777 or email the request letter with necessary document to the email mentioned below.
A copy of PAN and office registration letter is to be attached along with this form.

instructions: To record audio notice in notice board use Nepal Telecom’s GSM or Fixed Phones
dial_format: Dial 1610 - Area Code - Telephone Number subscribed for Audio Notice Board Service
steps: Input your 6-digit password as requested while filling the form for Notice Board service

instructions: Dial noticeboard number as provided by Nepal Telecom to listen to the recorded voice as notice
note: The access code 1618 can be dialed from all NT network (PSTN, GSM, VSAT and Payphones) throughout the Country

office: Nepal Telecom Provincial Directorate Kathmandu, Bagmati Pradesh Switching Division Sundhara, Kathmandu
